title: Unable to apply cat between Variables
body_html:
Hi there,

I am confused by the behaviour of torch.cat. I'm trying to do the following:

In [9]: x = torch.zeros(1)

In [10]: v = ag.Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 4))

In [11]: torch.cat((v, x), dim=2)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-11-a16158ed9876> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat((v, x), dim=2)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py in cat(iterable, dim)
    895         @staticmethod
    896         def cat(iterable, dim=0):
--> 897             return Concat.apply(dim, *iterable)
    898
    899         @staticmethod

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py in forward(ctx, dim, *inputs)
    314     def forward(ctx, dim, *inputs):
    315         ctx.dim = dim
--> 316         ctx.input_sizes = [i.size(dim) for i in inputs]
    317         return torch.cat(inputs, dim)
    318

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py in <listcomp>(.0)
    314     def forward(ctx, dim, *inputs):
    315         ctx.dim = dim
--> 316         ctx.input_sizes = [i.size(dim) for i in inputs]
    317         return torch.cat(inputs, dim)
    318

RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: dimension 2 out of range of 1D tensor at /Users/soumith/code/builder/wheel/pytorch-src/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:24

I've tried to transform the torch.zeros() in a Variable as well but it doesn't work. Am I doing something wrong? Because if I try to do the following it works:

torch.cat((torch.randn(1, 1, 4), torch.zeros(1)), dim=2)

Ideas?

Alessandro

body:
Hi there,

I am confused by the behaviour of ``torch.cat``. I'm trying to do the following:
```
In [9]: x = torch.zeros(1)

In [10]: v = ag.Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 4))

In [11]: torch.cat((v, x), dim=2)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-11-a16158ed9876> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat((v, x), dim=2)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py in cat(iterable, dim)
    895         @staticmethod
    896         def cat(iterable, dim=0):
--> 897             return Concat.apply(dim, *iterable)
    898
    899         @staticmethod

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py in forward(ctx, dim, *inputs)
    314     def forward(ctx, dim, *inputs):
    315         ctx.dim = dim
--> 316         ctx.input_sizes = [i.size(dim) for i in inputs]
    317         return torch.cat(inputs, dim)
    318

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py in <listcomp>(.0)
    314     def forward(ctx, dim, *inputs):
    315         ctx.dim = dim
--> 316         ctx.input_sizes = [i.size(dim) for i in inputs]
    317         return torch.cat(inputs, dim)
    318

RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: dimension 2 out of range of 1D tensor at /Users/soumith/code/builder/wheel/pytorch-src/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:24
```
I've tried to transform the torch.zeros() in a Variable as well but it doesn't work. Am I doing something wrong? Because if I try to do the following it works:

```
torch.cat((torch.randn(1, 1, 4), torch.zeros(1)), dim=2)
```

Ideas? 

Alessandro
